intro: Carapichea aubletii, commonly known as the golden star vine, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble stars. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface and emits a faintly aromatic scent. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
